授業目的:
This research seminar will build on the academic inquiries
begun in Research I for writing and completing the graduation thesis.
到達目標:
1. Gaining confidence in one's reading,
writing, and presentation skills.2. Collecting, analyzing and correctly interpreting survey data.3. Writing all sections of a graduation thesis (summary, introduction, data analysis and results, discussion, conclusion).4. Presenting one's research findings.
関連科目: Research Seminar I and courses related to Development Economics, Statistics and Data Analysis.
授業方法:
The seminar will be tailored to individual
student learning goals, timelines, and writing skills.

トピック.授業計画1:
The schedule of the seminar will be co-designed with students enabling progression throughout the year with a flow as follows:

April-May: Finalizing the literature review and data collection/analysis.

June-July: Starting to write the main body of the thesis. Presentations/progress reports. 

September-October: Editing and refining the main body of the thesis. Writing the introduction and conclusion.

November-December: Editing the thesis, preparing a list of references, and completion of graduation thesis. Executive summary and presentations.
トピック.授業外学習2: The completion of the graduation thesis is our shared goal. Students are expected to take initiative, engage with the chosen topic, take leadership in researching and writing. Students will be asked to share research progress and findings with other students.

学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Feedback at mid-term and year's end.

Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.Research Seminars:1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.4. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.
On-going - verbal and in writing - direct edits to writing also in this quest to complete the graduation thesis.
